data.title: Last Brick
data.statement:
I challenge you to a game! I'll make a pile of bricks, and we'll take turns removing bricks from the pile. If you remove the last brick, you win!

But we don't have to play the whole game. I'll let you go first, and if you make the perfect move, I'll resign. If you don't make the perfect move, well, then you're going to lose.

What if no perfect move exists you say? Well, then let me go first!

Your solution must output a number representing the number of bricks you wish to remove on your first turn, or {{PASS}} if you do not wish to take the first turn. The maximum number of bricks you are allowed to take during a turn will vary from game to game. Players must take at least 1 brick on each turn (except the first, since you have the option to pass).
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
read max:int

write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[n]] for the starting number of bricks in the pile.
<<Line 2:>> An integer [[max]] for the maximum number of bricks that can be removed from the pile during each turn.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1 :>> A number representing the number of bricks you wish to remove on your first turn, or {{PASS}}. This must be the perfect choice.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

I challenge you to a game! I'll make a pile of bricks, and we'll take turns removing bricks from the pile. If you remove the last brick, you win!

But we don't have to play the whole game. I'll let you go first, and if you make the perfect move, I'll resign. If you don't make the perfect move, well, then you're going to lose.

What if no perfect move exists you say? Well, then let me go first!

Your solution must output a number representing the number of bricks you wish to remove on your first turn, or PASS if you do not wish to take the first turn. The maximum number of bricks you are allowed to take during a turn will vary from game to game. Players must take at least 1 brick on each turn (except the first, since you have the option to pass).
Input
Line 1: An integer n for the starting number of bricks in the pile.
Line 2: An integer max for the maximum number of bricks that can be removed from the pile during each turn.
Output
Line 1 : A number representing the number of bricks you wish to remove on your first turn, or PASS. This must be the perfect choice.
Constraints
1000 ≤ n ≤ 2026
90 ≤ max ≤ 100
Example
Input
2026
100
Output
6
